frontmatter.title: Contextual save bar
frontmatter.shortDescription: Informs merchants of their options once they have made changes to a form on the page or while creating a new object.

examples.title: Default
examples.description: Use the save action to provide an opportunity to save changes. Use the discard action to allow merchants the option to discard their changes. Use the message to provide helpful context on the nature of those changes.

examples.title: With flush contents
examples.description: Use the alignContentFlush flag when you want to omit the logo from the contextual save bar and repurpose that space to extend the message contents fully to the left side of the container.

examples.title: With full width
examples.description: Use the fullWidth flag when you want to remove the default max-width set on the contextual save bar.

pageProps.seoDescription: The contextual save bar tells merchants their options once they have made changes to a form on the page. This component is also shown while creating a new object like a product or customer. Merchants can use this component to save or discard their work.

members.name: alignContentFlush
members.description: Extend the contents section to be flush with the left edge

members.name: message
members.description: Accepts a string of content that will be rendered to the left of the actions

members.name: saveAction
members.description: Save or commit contextual save bar action with text defaulting to 'Save'

members.name: discardAction
members.description: Discard or cancel contextual save bar action with text defaulting to 'Discard'

members.name: fullWidth
members.description: Remove the normal max-width on the contextual save bar

members.name: contextControl
members.description: Accepts a component that is used to help users switch between different contexts

members.name: secondaryMenu
members.description: Accepts a node that is rendered to the left of the discard and save actions
